title.rendered: Katherine Fuller Scholarship | University of Guelph, Canada

content.rendered:
Get the Katherine Fuller Scholarship provided by the University of Guelph, Canada by enrolling in the Winter Application to qualify for the $1,000 University scholarship in the fall session.

Contents on This Page

Toggle
  • Scholarship Summary
  • Eligibility
  • How Can I Apply?
  • Benefits

In an effort to encourage international students to pursue higher education in Canada, the Katherine Fuller Scholarship program has been established by the University of Guelph for the academic year.

The scholarship is intended to assist international students who want to begin their first year of college at the University of Guelph’s Department of Family Relations and Applied Nutrition. In order to receive the $1,000 university scholarship in the fall, the winner must enroll.

Established in 1964, the University of Guelph is a research university that offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs in a somewhat informal setting. It is one of Canada’s top 18 general research institutes. Its objective is to support individuals and groups that enhance the institute’s reputation, quality, and significance to society by providing opportunities for investments.

It is one of Canada’s best universities due to the high standard of its education, tests, and students’ exceptional skills. It offers opportunities for experiential education and serves as or incorporates direct and formal educational curricula. Students at the University of Guelph can acquire knowledge and experience through the work-study program.

Scholarship Summary

  • University Name: University of Guelph
  • Department: Department of Family Relations and Applied Nutrition
  • Course Level: Undergraduate
  • Award: $1,000
  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: Domestic and International
  • The award can be taken in Canada
  • Application Deadline: 15 May 2024.

Eligibility

Candidates must satisfy all of the following in order to be eligible for a scholarship from the University of Guelph:

  • Students from other countries, permanent residents of Canada, and Canadian citizens are all eligible to apply.
  • Any university-offered undergraduate program in the Department of Family Relations and Applied Nutrition will be eligible for the scholarship.
  • All of the following requirements must be met by applicants to be considered:
    Both non-Canadian PR-PP and Canadian PR-PP applicants are eligible.
  • The student who has contributed the most to student activities on campus or in residence will receive the award.
  • Students who are enrolled on a full-time basis in any program that the Department of Family Relations and Applied Nutrition offers and who have completed between 5.0 and 10.0 credits.

Read Also>>>The Guelph University Admission Requirement 2024

How Can I Apply?

To submit an application for the University of Guelph Scholarship, please follow the steps below:

  • To finish the application process for the course they’ve chosen, applicants can sign up through the university’s online portal or the Common Application. To be considered for this funding opportunity, the applicant must submit an online application.

The following documents must be submitted by the students to the University of Guelph:
Students must meet the academic entry requirements of the program in order to be admitted to the university.

  • Official transcripts,
  • high school transcripts,
  • information about the student’s profile,
  • and specific country requirements.

By completing their English proficiency requirements, students must demonstrate their proficiency.

Benefits

The recipient of a University of Guelph Scholarship will enjoy the following advantages:

In the fall, the University of Guelph will provide one $1,000 scholarship to a registered student.

Apply Here
